title: Quiz 7: Social Structure & Stratification
description: Understanding social structure, status, roles, and the hierarchy of social stratification.

questions.question: Match the type of status to its definition:

pairs.right: Involuntary, fixed at birth (e.g., race, sex)
All the positions an individual occupies

questions.explanation: Ascribed = given; Achieved = earned; Master = dominant.
questions.hint: Think about how you got the status.

questions.question: What is 'Role Conflict'?

options.text: Conflict between roles of two different statuses held by one person

questions.explanation: Role conflict occurs when demands of different statuses (e.g., mother vs. employee) clash. Conflict within one role is 'Role Strain'.
questions.hint: Clash between work and family is a classic example.

questions.question: Social ___BLANK___ is the segmentation of society into different hierarchical arrangements or strata based on wealth, power, and prestige.
questions.explanation: Stratification refers to the layers (strata) of inequality in society.
questions.hint: Like layers of rock in geology.

questions.question: According to Max Weber, what are the three components of social stratification? (Select three)
The 'Caste System' is an example of an OPEN stratification system where social mobility is easy.
questions.explanation: False. Caste is a CLOSED/RIGID system based on birth with little to no mobility. Class systems are relatively open.
questions.hint: Can you change your caste easily?

questions.question: Which theory views social stratification as functional, inevitable, and beneficial for society because it ensures important roles are filled by qualified people?
questions.explanation: Functionalism argues inequality motivates people to fill difficult roles. Conflict theory views it as oppression.

questions.question: What sociological concept refers to the movement of individuals or groups between different social positions or strata?
questions.explanation: Social mobility is the ability to move up or down the social ladder.

questions.question: Which form of social structure refers to the ranking of people in a hierarchy (inequality)?
questions.explanation: Vertical structure refers to hierarchy/ranking (up/down). Horizontal refers to relationships/communities (side-to-side).

questions.question: What are the characteristics of the Hindu Caste System mentioned in the text? (Select all that apply)

options.text: It is a rigid and closed system

questions.explanation: Caste systems are rigid, require endogamy, and assign occupations. Mobility is restricted.
questions.hint: It defines who you marry and what you do.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ refers to characteristics that determine a group's capacity to withstand and recover from disasters/hazards.
questions.explanation: Vulnerability links social stratification to health outcomes and risk.
